@ANhentaiUser: Actually, yes! It is a phrase. The exact wording of it was 金魚のフン, which, as I mentioned earlier, literally means a goldfish's poop. Another common form of it is 金魚のうんこ, which just means the same thing. Like I mentioned, it's used to describe someone who tags along or follows someone else around. I try to stick with literal translations when I can so I'm not taking too many liberties when working on something, so that's what happened here too.
oh yume gonna be mad
@Rainsong, is that a popular japanese phrase? I think there's an episode of One Punch Man with a very similar line ("you're always sticking to Saitama like shit on a goldfish").
she seems to have already liked him without the hypnosis = w =
REAL SHIT ◉‿◉

@thatguy: You know how when a goldfish poops, it's kinda long and stringy and trails after them for a bit? It's like that. I just translated the line as it literally was because I couldn't think of a better way of wording it. She basically trailed after him wherever he went.

@hanz: yeah I've since revised how I typeset sfx haha. Inagita killed me with the last few pages, but I didn't want to change how I styled it that late into the chapter.

Hi all, translator here. Just putting out a quick notice. If you like what you see, please consider following me on either wordpress or twitter. My blog can be found at Rainsongtranslations.wordpress.com and my twitter handle is @RainsongTL.
